title: Misleading diagnostic when `Clone::clone` is called on an unclonable type

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

body:
Given the following code: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
struct Unclonable;

fn main() {
    let original = vec![vec![Unclonable]];
    let clone = original.clone();
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0599]: the method `clone` exists for struct `Vec<Vec<Unclonable>>`, but its trait bounds were not satisfied
   --> src/main.rs:7:26
    |
5   |       let clone = original.clone();
    |                            ^^^^^ method cannot be called on `Vec<Vec<Unclonable>>` due to unsatisfied trait bounds
    |
    = note: the following trait bounds were not satisfied:
            `Vec<Unclonable>: Clone`
            which is required by `Vec<Vec<Unclonable>>: Clone`
```

Current diagnostic is a bit misleading, since the issue is not with vector per se, but with a struct. Ideally, the diagnostic should dive into the type and give a hint to the actual cause. This is especially strange since a minor change to the source results in a much better error output:

```diff
-    let original = vec![vec![Unclonable]];
+    let original = vec![Unclonable];
```

```
error[E0599]: the method `clone` exists for struct `Vec<Unclonable>`, but its trait bounds were not satisfied
   --> src/main.rs:7:26
    |
1   |   struct Unclonable;
    |   ------------------ doesn't satisfy `Unclonable: Clone`
...
5   |       let clone = original.clone();
    |                            ^^^^^ method cannot be called on `Vec<Unclonable>` due to unsatisfied trait bounds
    |
    = note: the following trait bounds were not satisfied:
            `Unclonable: Clone`
            which is required by `Vec<Unclonable>: Clone`
```
